home.hero_description: Founded by a family of artisans in 1990. Every pair is meticulously hand-lasted by our master craftsman, preserving the sacred traditions of the Steppe in every stitch.
home.hero_image_alt: The Master Craftsman hand-lasting a boot
home.heritage_image_alt: Master craftsman at work in the Domog atelier
home.collection_description: Each boot begins as raw leather and a wooden last. What emerges—forty hours later—carries the weight of tradition and the lightness of true craftsmanship.
home.heritage_p1: Our founder learned his craft from masters who remembered the old ways—men who had shod the horses of khans, who knew that a boot must speak to both stirrup and ceremony.
home.heritage_p2: Today, those same techniques endure. We cure leather by seasons, not hours. We shape by hand, not machine. We sign each pair, because anonymity belongs to factories, not artisans.
home.heritage_p3: Presidents have worn our work. Champions have competed in it. We keep no photographs—only the wooden lasts, shaped to their feet.
home.pillar_1_desc: Leather pulled by human muscle, not machines. A dialogue measured in millimeters, coaxed into memory over a wooden form. The rejection of mass production is our quietest, strongest statement.
home.pillar_2_desc: Vegetable-tanned and fragrant. It begins the color of raw honey and darkens to become a map of everywhere you have walked. It does not just age; it evolves with you.
home.pillar_3_desc: Born from the hands of nomadic saddlers. Built not for seasons, but for decades. Our construction is designed to be resoled, ensuring a relationship that lasts a lifetime.

about.manifesto_title: Between the Steppe and the Piazza
about.tension_quote: There is a silence in the Mongolian grasslands that teaches patience. There is a precision in Italian ateliers that demands perfection. We live in the space between.
about.nomadic_p1: Our ancestors rode for days across frozen plains. Their boots were not fashion—they were survival. The upturned toe, born from reverence for the earth, allowed a rider to slip free from the stirrup in a fall. Every curve had purpose. Every stitch, consequence.
about.nomadic_p2: This is the inheritance we carry: footwear forged not in showrooms, but in necessity. Leather cured to withstand temperatures that would crack lesser materials. Soles stitched by hand because machines cannot feel the grain.
about.nomadic_p3: We do not make boots. We make instruments for traversing the earth.
about.italian_p1: Yet strength without grace is brutality. We learned this watching the great houses of Europe—how a single hem, cut one millimeter shorter, transforms presence. How negative space speaks louder than ornament. How restraint is the ultimate sophistication.
about.italian_p2: We apply this discipline to our heritage. Where tradition called for embellishment, we often choose silence. Where convention demanded color, we find power in patina. The Swiss movements of Furlan Marri taught us: what you leave out matters more than what you put in.
about.italian_p3: Our boots whisper. They do not shout.
about.master_p1: In 1990, my father opened a small workshop in Ulaanbaatar. He had no business plan. He had only his hands—hands that had apprenticed under masters who remembered the old ways, before factories, before shortcuts.
about.master_p2: Thirty-five years later, those same hands still touch every pair we make. Not symbolically. Literally. He inspects each boot at three stages: after lasting, after stitching, after finishing. If the leather doesn't sing under his fingertips, it goes back.
about.master_quote: A machine can measure a boot. Only hands can know it.
about.master_p3: Presidents have worn his work. Champions have competed in it. But my father does not keep photographs with dignitaries. He keeps the lasts—wooden forms shaped to the feet of those he's served. Each one a conversation. Each one a promise kept.
about.promise_p1: A Domog boot is not a purchase. It is a partnership. We guarantee our craftsmanship for life—not because marketing demands it, but because our reputation requires it.
about.promise_p2: If a sole wears through, we replace it. If a stitch fails, we repair it. If the leather needs reconditioning after a decade of wear, bring it home. We remember every pair we've made. We honor every foot we've served.
about.promise_p3: This is not customer service. This is craftsmanship.
about.invitation_p1: We are not for everyone. We are for those who understand that some things cannot be rushed. Who know that a boot broken in over years becomes an extension of the self. Who believe that craft is not nostalgia—it is resistance.
about.invitation_p2: If this speaks to you, welcome. Take your time. Browse our collection. Read our stories. And when you're ready—only when you're ready—we'll be here.
about.invitation_p3: Some things are worth waiting for.
